thread.title: Stranger Things will last ‘four or five seasons’, Ross and Matt Duffer say | Daily Telegraph
thread.title_full: Stranger Things will last ‘four or five seasons’, Ross and Matt Duffer say | Daily Telegraph

title: Stranger Things will last ‘four or five seasons’, Ross and Matt Duffer say | Daily Telegraph
text:
Stranger Things will last ‘four or five seasons’, say creators Ross and Matt Duffer Staff writer, News Corp Australia Network February 14, 2017 1:20pm 
IT’S one of the most anticipated new seasons of 2017 — the second series of Stranger Things. 
Now, the co-creators of the hit Netflix series have hinted about the show’s future. 
American brothers Ross and Matt Duffer said Stranger Things will likely last about four or five seasons. 
“Everything changes as we move forward so we’ll see,” Ross Duffer told Entertainment Weekly . 
His Stranger Things co-creator Matt Duffer said he intended the show “to have a really finite ending”. media_camera A look at the upcoming second series of Stranger Things, starring Winona Ryder (far right). Picture: Netflix media_camera The co-creators of Stranger Things say ‘everything changes’ in the upcoming second series, set to screen in October. Picture: Netflix media_camera The bowl cut is still in, according to this new photo from the upcoming series of Stranger Things. Picture: Netflix 
“I don’t want it to be one of those shows that runs out of gas and they lose it because they’re losing interest,” he said. 
“You wanna end when you’re on top.” media_camera Stranger Things seems to channel Ghostbusters in its next series. Picture: Netflix media_camera Trick or treat, Stranger Things-style. Picture: Netflix 
The pair said the upcoming second series — which Netflix said will premiere on Halloween (October 31) — felt like a movie. 
“Hopefully you’ll come to the end of season 2 and feel fully satisfied and want more but you’ll feel like it has come to a conclusion,” Ross Duffer told EW . 
“But also we’ve laid the ground work for further seasons.”
